comments.body:
@thisguy1337: I disagree, if you don't allow commercial use for your content it cannot be used in for example Wikipedia, (most) libraries, sites that ask for donations, etc. Not allowing commercial use is hurting mostly small sites, organisations, and individuals, not large corporations.

Read [Free Culture: Reasons not to use a Creative Commons -NC license](http://freedomdefined.org/Licenses/NC) if you want to know more about this.

More sites to consider reading:

* [Understanding Free Cultural Works](https://creativecommons.org/share-your-work/public-domain/freeworks/)
* [Why Wikipedia doesn't allow CreativeCommons NonCommercial licensed material](https://meta.wikimedia.org/wiki/Free_knowledge_based_on_Creative_Commons_licenses)

See [Open Definition: Conformant Licenses](http://opendefinition.org/licenses/) for a list of recommendations
